translated: Sutra of the Names of the Thousand Buddhas of the Past Adorned Eon, also known as Gathering the Great Merits of All Buddhas
Appended to the Kaiyuan Catalog of the Liang Dynasty
The sutra says: If there are good men and good women who hear the names of the Buddhas of the three times and three eons,

rejoice in faith and understanding, praise and extol them, take refuge and bow to them, and are able to write them down, explain them to others, paint Buddha images, or make offerings of incense, flowers, and music, praising the Buddha's merits and sincerely making prostrations, it is superior to filling the worlds of the ten directions with precious treasures and pure maá¹‡i jewels, accumulating them up to the Brahma Heaven, and making offerings for a hundred thousand eons.

These good men and good women, having already made offerings to these Buddhas, will in their subsequent lives serve the Buddhas, continuing until they become Buddhas themselves, without end. They will all be given predictions by the Buddhas of the three times and three eons. Wherever they are born, they will always encounter the Three Jewels, be reborn in the Buddha lands, have their six sense faculties complete, and not fall into the eight difficult situations. They will attain the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks of the Buddhas, and be fully adorned.
If they are able to prostrate with their five limbs on the ground and declare with their own mouths:

'I now make universal obeisance to all the Buddhas of the ten directions, three times, and throughout the three periods of time. May the three evil paths be at peace, may the country be prosperous and the people secure. May the sentient beings with wrong views turn towards the right path, give rise to the bodhi mind, and hold this merit. May they, together with all the sentient beings of the six paths, be reborn in the land of AmitÄyus Buddha.'

Make a great vow to cause all sentient beings to be born in that land, with the excellent physical characteristics, wisdom, and eloquence like AmitÃ¢bha Buddha, and attain the majestic and lofty fruits and rewards with an immeasurable lifespan.ğŸ”½Homage to Buddha Flower Light, Homage to Buddha Honored by People, Homage to Buddha Lion's Steps
